ast.name: UMvC3 Guide
ast.comment: A program that helps a person get better at Ultimate Marvel vs. Capcom 3, whether they are a beginner or advanced player. It also has detailed character specific information with many videos to help the user learn the basics of the character, their combos, and some examples of high level play. In the advanced section and detailed character specific sections, fighting game terminology is used, which may be familiar to the user but it is intuitive enough for them to understand if they are not. Be advised as some vulgar language may be used in the videos.

initBody.text: Background colour is set to match the theme of the background image.

displayBody.text: An overlay layout is used as text and images will be placed on top of the background.

body.text: The background is posted to the wall. Since Touchdevelop has limitations on the pixel dimensions of an uploaded image, the background was split up into two parts, vertically. They were uploaded separately and are now joined by posting them one after another. The size of the boxes are set as they will need to know which space of the screen to take up. In this case, they take up the entire width of the screen, and their proportional length. The length was found by dividing the number of pixels in the original picture by the page width value, and then dividing the length by this value. This helps constrain the proportions of the image (height and width reduced by a factor of 24).
The boxes with pictures are made with appropriate dimensions to fit the screen. No margins are used in order to combine them into one large background.

All boxes in this "nest" are used for information, and are spaced to place this text in the appropriate areas on top of the image. They use the same size white font, which would be changed if it was possible to change the font type. The text is wrapped so that it is not cut off in the box by its fixed width, which is used in order to mold the text inside of the image.
The second box, and the following boxes, follow the same style as the first, with the same font colour and box width. They include different information, but are all very similar in their code.

initBody.text: Background colour is set to match the theme of the background image.

displayBody.text: An overlay layout is used as text and images will be placed on top of the background.

body.text: The background is posted to the wall. Since Touchdevelop has limitations on the pixel dimensions of an uploaded image, the background was split up into two parts, vertically. They were uploaded separately and are now joined by posting them one after another. The size of the boxes are set as they will need to know which space of the screen to take up. In this case, they take up the entire width of the screen, and their proportional length. The length was found by dividing the number of pixels in the original picture by the page width value, and then dividing the length by this value. This helps constrain the proportions of the image (height and width reduced by a factor of 24).
The boxes with pictures are made with appropriate dimensions to fit the screen. No margins are used in order to combine them into one large background.

All boxes in this "nest" are used for information, and are spaced to place this text in the appropriate areas on top of the image. They use the same size white font, which would be changed if it was possible to change the font type. The text is wrapped so that it is not cut off in the box by its fixed width, which is used in order to mold the text inside of the image.

Nested boxes are used to change the layout of the text, in order to add a picture with a video link in an area where text would normally be. This is similar to something like a magazine article in the way the text is manipulated. The horizontal layout allows for columns in this row, which are the text and the picture.
The thumbnail of the video and its link act as an embedded video, which is seen when the thumbnail is tapped.
The box goes to the video link when clicked.
The second box, and the following boxes, follow the same style as the first, with the same font colour and box width. They include different information, but are all very similar in their code.

initBody.text: The colour of the background is set to correspond with the image's colour scheme.

displayBody.text: The images are set in an overlay layout, in order to place text and pictures on top of the background. This allows for text to be easily modified, thumbnails to be updated, and video links to be made possible when the thumbnails are tapped.

body.text: Again, due to limitations of Touchdevelop, two pictures were made which become one large picture when they are posted to the wall one after another. The size of the boxes are set as they will need to know which space of the screen to take up. In this case, they take up the entire width of the screen, and their proportional length. The length was found by dividing the number of pixels in the original picture by the page width value, and then dividing the length by this value. This helps constrain the proportions of the image (height and width reduced by a factor of 24).
The boxes with pictures are made with appropriate dimensions to fit the screen. No margins are used in order to combine them into one large background.
This box is molded to the dimensions of the area of the image that it will go on top of, which contains text/information.
Another way the next piece of text can be placed is in a nested box of the first, but with only a change in the margin height, to allow the box to be pushed downwards with respect to the first box.

A row of multiple boxes is created, far down on the image, with each column containing the thumbnail of its corresponding video link when tapped. These videos provide information on the character, and are labelled with a special font that is used in the background image.
The box goes to the video link when clicked.

The size of the boxes are set as they will need to know which space of the screen to take up. In this case, they take up the entire width of the screen, and their proportional length. The box goes to the video link when clicked.

initBody.text: The appropriate background colour is set.

displayBody.text: A vertical layout is used in order to make the many rows of icons that are seen.

body.text: Since this row consists of one picture, the large C. Viper thumbnail, this box is under the vertical layout property. Padding is used to make the button have space from the edges of the screen, and it has a command to go to the C. Viper page when pressed.
This is another row of the tiles. In this row, there are two separate columns. In order to make these columns, boxes must be nested inside this box.

Nested boxes are used to put a picture in a box under the horizontal layout. Having pictures in boxes allows for padding between the pictures, and for the separate pictures to have separate handlers (go to different pages) depending on which picture is tapped.

displayBody.text: Again, for the following two boxes, they are using the vertical layout. Therefore, they will be seen in separate rows, they will go to their corresponding pages when tapped, and they will have an appropriate amount of space between the pictures and the edges of the screen.
